textsList.introduction.p1: Alina, zuallererst m√∂chte ich dir sagen, dass ich dich mit meinem ganzen Herzen, meinem ganzen Geist, meinem ganzen K√∂rper und meiner ganzen Seele liebe. textsList.introduction.p3: Wenn Sie sich einsam f√ºhlen und mich vermissen, ich aber schlafe oder bei der Arbeit bin, bin ich hier in diesem Buch und warte darauf, mit Ihnen zu sprechen und Ihnen Gesellschaft zu leisten. textsList.the_anatomy_of_everything_cont: Ich wei√ü, dass du mich immer wieder sagen h√∂rtest, dass du meine ganze Welt bist, mein Ein und Alles, und dass ich alles mit dir haben will. Nat√ºrlich werde ich genau das tun, was Sie w√ºnschen, und ich werde Ihnen in diesem Buch auch meine Welt erz√§hlen, denn es kann Zeiten geben, in denen Sie zur√ºckkommen und es immer wieder lesen m√∂chten, und seien wir ehrlich, indem Sie durch unsere riesige Welt zur√ºckbl√§ttern Die Menge an Texten ist nicht so einfach.

Sie sollten jedoch wissen, dass ‚Äûalles‚Äú nicht nur eine Sache bedeutet. textsList.my_love_content.p1: Liebe ist ein so kraftvolles Wort und es gibt so viele verschiedene M√∂glichkeiten, dieses Wort zu verwenden. Ich liebe Fr√ºhst√ºck! Ich liebe es zu tanzen! textsList.my_strength_content.p1: ^ Vielleicht denken Sie: ‚ÄûWas zum Teufel hat dieses Stahldrahtseil damit zu tun, dass ich Ihre St√§rke bin?‚Äú Na ja, meine Welt, ich sage es euch, denn ich finde, dass sie eigentlich ganz passend ist. textsList.my_strength_content.p2: So wie jeder dieser einzelnen Str√§nge, die miteinander verwoben sind und das Seil als Ganzes unglaublich stark und auch flexibel machen, indem es den Druck gleichm√§√üig in alle Richtungen verteilt, halten mich die kleinen Dinge, die du mir sagst und f√ºr mich tust, zusammen und machen mich st√§rker als ich jemals alleine sein k√∂nnte. textsList.my_strength_content.p3: Jedes dieser scheinbar ‚Äûkleinen‚Äú Dinge, die du f√ºr mich tust, besteht in Wirklichkeit aus einzelnen Stahldr√§hten, die sich umeinander winden und mir die Kraft und Flexibilit√§t geben, zu wissen, dass du selbst unter starkem Druck in vielen Dingen immer da bist Manchmal muss ich dem Druck einfach ein wenig in die eine oder andere Richtung nachgeben, bis er sich wieder beruhigt. textsList.my_strength_content.p4: Aber das geht √ºber das reine Okaysein hinaus. textsList.my_strength_content.p7: Du bist meine St√§rke, Alina. textsList.my_inspiration_and_my_motivati: Ich habe Inspiration und Motivation in einem Abschnitt zusammengefasst und werde erkl√§ren, warum. ‚ÄûMotivation ist oft vor√ºbergehend, aber Inspiration kann ein Leben lang anhalten.

Das meine ich mit jedem Molek√ºl und jedem Teilchen meines Wesens, und ich glaube, dass man es auch sp√ºren kann. Ihr unvergessliches L√§cheln, Ihr herzerw√§rmendes Lachen, Ihre beruhigende Stimme, Ihre wundersch√∂nen, tiefen Augen, Ihr strahlendes Gl√ºck und Ihr gro√ües Herz sind nur die ‚ÄûSpitze des Eisbergs‚Äú von allem, was ich an Ihnen liebe, aber diese Liste w√§chst jeden Tag mit jeder neuen Entdeckung. Allerdings gibt es wirklich keine Worte, die beschreiben k√∂nnten, wie sch√∂n und erstaunlich Sie f√ºr mich sind, aber ich hoffe, dass dieses Buch Ihnen zumindest eine Vorstellung davon vermittelt, wie viel Sie mir wirklich bedeuten.

Im Laufe meines Lebens hatte ich viele verschiedene Jobs, habe viele verschiedene Hobbys gespielt, viele verschiedene Menschen kennengelernt und an vielen verschiedenen Orten gelebt, alles auf der Suche nach mir selbst. Lange Zeit hatte ich keine Ahnung, was ich wirklich wollte, weil es so viele verschiedene Dinge gab, die mir Spa√ü machten und die ich tun wollte, also beschloss ich, sie alle auszuprobieren, bis ich das fand, was mir gefiel. Erst als ich mich mit Programmierung und Webentwicklung besch√§ftigte, begann ich endlich zu erkennen und zu erkennen, was meine Leidenschaft, mein Hobby und meine berufliche Ausrichtung sind.

Diese neu entdeckte Richtung und Leidenschaft haben mich jedoch nicht vollendet und ich konnte immer noch eine Leere in mir sp√ºren. Ich habe versucht, meine Zeit mit mehr Programmieren, mehr Sport, mehr Unterhaltung, dem Erlernen von Sprachen usw. zu f√ºllen, aber nichts konnte diese L√ºcke f√ºllen. Schlie√ülich beschloss ich, es einfach zu akzeptieren und weiterzumachen. Abgesehen vom Programmieren war das Erlernen von Sprachen eine Sache, die mich wirklich begeisterte und die mir gro√üen Spa√ü machte. Dies f√ºhrte dazu, dass ich online neue Leute aus der ganzen Welt kennenlernte, von denen viele im Laufe der Zeit kamen und gingen. Aber du hattest von Anfang an etwas Besonderes an dir. Du bist mir nie aus dem Kopf gegangen, seit wir vor all den Jahren angefangen haben zu reden. Am Ende erlebte ich einige H√∂hen und Tiefen, und ich vertiefte mich in mein Studium und meine Arbeit, sodass ich eine ganze Zeit lang distanziert war und wei√ü, dass wir nicht viel geredet haben. Aber wie ich bereits sagte, hast du mich nie vergessen und schlie√ülich dachte ich: ‚ÄûNun, jetzt kann ich es mir leisten, eine Reise nach Europa zu machen, ich wollte schon immer dorthin und ich k√∂nnte sehen, ob Alina dazu bereit w√§re.‚Äú Treffen Sie mich pers√∂nlich.‚Äú

Wenn ich sehe, wo wir jetzt stehen, bin ich so froh, dass ich mich entschieden habe zu gehen, dass ich beschlossen habe, Sie zu fragen, ob Sie bereit w√§ren, mich zu treffen, und vor allem, dass Sie Ja gesagt haben. Mein Leben hat sich so sehr ver√§ndert, seit wir angefangen haben zu reden, und ja, auf eine sehr, sehr gute Art und Weise. Das Gef√ºhl, das ich die meiste Zeit meines Lebens hatte, nicht zu wissen, wohin ich wollte, was ich tun wollte oder mit wem ich zusammen sein wollte, ist zu einer fernen Erinnerung geworden. Bei dir, Alina, sehe ich klar, was ich im Leben will, und ich spreche √ºber alle Aspekte, lasse aber nat√ºrlich Raum f√ºr Spontaneit√§t und Wachstum (wir wissen nicht immer, was das Leben bereith√§lt, aber ich bin offen daf√ºr). alles, besonders wenn es mit dir zu tun hat). Ich wei√ü, was ich in meiner Karriere will, ich wei√ü, womit ich meine Zeit verbringen m√∂chte, ich wei√ü, wie ich zur Welt beitragen m√∂chte, ich wei√ü, wohin ich will, und ja, ich wei√ü genau, wer ich sein m√∂chte mit.

Ich will alles mit dir, Alina, und ich hoffe, dass du alles mit mir haben wirst. Was ist alles? Nun, ich werde es dir sagen. Ich m√∂chte jede Nacht neben dir im selben Bett liegen k√∂nnen, damit ich mit dir in meinen Armen einschlafen kann. Ich m√∂chte dir Gute-Nacht-K√ºsse geben, mit meinen Fingern durch dein Haar fahren, in deine wundersch√∂nen blauen Augen schauen und dir jeden Abend vor dem Schlafengehen sagen, dass ich dich liebe und dass du die einzige Frau in meinem Leben bist, die ich will und brauche. Ich m√∂chte jeden Morgen am n√§chsten Morgen neben dir aufwachen und dir K√ºsse geben, wenn ich aufstehe, um dir Fr√ºhst√ºck und Kaffee zu machen und dabei zu helfen, deine Sachen f√ºr die Arbeit vorzubereiten, w√§hrend ich mich auch f√ºr die Arbeit fertig mache.

Ich m√∂chte Ihnen k√∂rperlich und intim nahe sein und bin f√ºr Sie da, um Ihnen zu helfen und Sie bei allem zu unterst√ºtzen, was Sie f√ºr Ihren Erfolg ben√∂tigen. Wenn wir zusammen sind, m√∂chte ich Ihnen ein Leben voller wahr gewordener Tr√§ume und einer F√ºlle von Gl√ºck und Liebe schenken, die niemals ersch√∂pft ist. Sicher, ich wei√ü, dass das Leben nicht perfekt ist und dass es schlechte Tage und schwierige Zeiten geben wird, aber selbst wenn das passiert, m√∂chte ich an Ihrer Seite sein, um Sie zu tr√∂sten und Ihnen bei allem zu helfen, was auch passiert. Und wenn ich meine eigenen schlechten Tage und schwierigen Zeiten habe, werde ich offen und ehrlich zu Ihnen sein, und wir werden alles gemeinsam durchstehen, weil ich wei√ü, dass Sie hier sind, meine Welt. Meine Welt, bitte wisse, dass ich durch alles, durch dick und d√ºnn, durch Gl√ºck und Melancholie, was auch immer das Leben uns bringen mag, egal was ich mit dir sein m√∂chte.

Ich m√∂chte Ihnen helfen und dabei sein, Ihr erstes Fahrzeug zu bekommen, damit wir gemeinsam Fahrten unternehmen k√∂nnen, zu Orten, die wir noch nie gesehen haben, und durch zuf√§llige Stra√üen, nur um zu sehen, wohin sie uns bringen. Ich m√∂chte mit dir in der K√ºche tanzen, wenn wir das Fr√ºhst√ºck kochen, und mit dir singen, w√§hrend wir uns danach gegenseitig beim Abwaschen helfen. Ich m√∂chte zu Ihnen nach Hause kommen und aufmerksam zuh√∂ren, wie Sie mir erz√§hlen, was an Ihrem Tag passiert ist, auch wenn es nur ein ganz normaler Tag war. Ich m√∂chte unsere gemeinsame Reise nach Santorini, Marokko und Israel buchen, wo wir gemeinsam neue und geliebte Orte erkunden und dabei interessante Menschen treffen k√∂nnen. Ich m√∂chte unsere eigenen Websites, unser eigenes Unternehmen, unsere eigenen Projekte erstellen, an denen wir gemeinsam arbeiten k√∂nnen, weil ich mich ganz auf Sie einlassen m√∂chte. Es ist wahr, meine Welt, ich kann nicht genug von dir bekommen.

Eines Tages, wenn die Zeit reif ist, m√∂chte ich mehr als nur dein Mann sein, Alina. Ich habe dir schon oft gesagt, dass ich in meinem Leben keinen Moment ohne dich will, und das meine ich wirklich ernst. Die Zeit ist mir egal und ich m√∂chte dich nicht abschrecken, indem ich sage ‚Äûden Rest meines Lebens‚Äú (obwohl das ganz passend zu meinen Gef√ºhlen zu sein scheint), ich sorge mich nur um dich und m√∂chte mit dir zusammen sein, Endeffekt. Ich war schon zu lange unsicher √ºber zu viele Dinge in meinem Leben, und jetzt, wo du in meinem Leben bist, sehe ich endlich klar alles, was ich in meinem Leben will und brauche. Du bist der, den ich in meinem Leben will und brauche, Alina, du bist das fehlende Teil in meinem Puzzle.

Ich wei√ü nicht, was die Zukunft bringt, meine Welt, und ich m√∂chte mich auch nicht damit besch√§ftigen, an Dinge zu denken, die passieren k√∂nnten, aber ich wei√ü, dass ich dich darin haben m√∂chte. Du bist mein Ein und Alles, Alina, und ich will alles mit dir. Konzentrieren wir uns auf das Hier und Jetzt, auf uns zusammen, aber ich m√∂chte nur, dass Sie wissen, dass ich wirklich alles mit Ihnen will, dass ich Ihnen engagiert und von ganzem Herzen ergeben bin und dass Sie sich nicht nur darauf verlassen k√∂nnen, dass ich Ihr Mann bin, sondern auch Sie Ich kann mich darauf verlassen, dass ich zu gegebener Zeit noch mehr f√ºr Sie tun werde. Jetzt lasst uns ein gemeinsames Leben voller Entdeckungen, Gl√ºck, Liebe, Abenteuer, Frieden und Inspiration beginnen!
theJudgeTextsList.author: Autor: Mitchell Wintrow
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_title: Chapter 1: The judge and the auras
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p1: Judge Raymond Elisando sat confidently and intently in his seat within the courtroom. The prosecution is pitching their closing statement at the moment, but Raymond doesn‚Äôt really need either the prosecutor or the defense attorney to know whether or not the defendant is guilty. No, because he has a secret, and this secret has been helping him move up the ranks quickly in his career.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p2: What is this secret? Well, you see, Judge Elisando happens to be able to see auras around people, particularly the people relying on his verdict and judgment on sentencing. To him, it‚Äôs abundantly clear when someone is guilty or innocent. When a defendant is truly innocent, there‚Äôs always a bright, constant, clear shine around them. It‚Äôs almost as if there is a bright white light shining directly onto the defendant, and they are in ultra-high definition, whereas everything else is just standard definition. Kind of like when a camera focuses on something or someone, and the background isn‚Äôt quite as clear.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p3: Now, when a defendant is actually guilty of whatever they have been charged with, there seems to be a strange distorting kind of shimmer surrounding the person. It‚Äôs almost as if all around the defendant there is a huge heat source causing the air around them to be heated up so much as to produce the distorting heat waves you might see rising off of the hot asphalt in an Arizona summer.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p4: Even though this is the case and he has this special ability, he still goes along with the usual show, because if he were to share this strange little secret, people would think he is crazy! They would surely throw him out of his position and maybe even send him to a mental institution. Seeing as how his career has been taking off quickly, it seems like he‚Äôs made the right decision in both using this unusual ability and keeping it a closely guarded secret. Now he‚Äôs sitting here in the courtroom once again, waiting for ‚Äúthe show‚Äù to finish so he can deliver the judgment he already knows he‚Äôll make.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p5: ‚ÄúSo, given the evidence we‚Äôve provided, your honor, we believe the defendant is not only guilty of possession of a controlled substance, but also guilty of having the intent to sell and distribute it, based on the amounts they were found to have in their possession. I have no further comments to make, your honor, I believe the evidence clearly speaks for itself. Thank you.‚Äù, says the prosecutor, Mr. Eddie Thompson, as he walks back to his side and sits down. Eddie gathers up all of the documents lying on the table, taps them on the table to line them all up and then puts them back into his briefcase.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p6: The defense lawyer, Mr. Victor Broughton, stands up, approaches Judge Elisando, and begins to say his closing remarks, but Raymond is looking directly at the shifting, distorted aura shimmering around the defendant. `Sorry Victor, but this guy is guilty as can be. It doesn‚Äôt really matter what closing remarks you have to say, because I definitely see jail time in the defendant‚Äôs future.`, Raymond thinks while looking intently at the defendant, or rather at the aura emanating from the defendant like waves of heat from a stove.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p7: ‚Äú... and that‚Äôs why we ask that you consider the entirety of the circumstances surrounding this case, your honor. Yes, my client has had a troubled past and clearly has a substance abuse problem, but he is by no means a drug dealer or distributor. Thank you.‚Äù, finishes Victor, walking back to his side and taking a seat with a confident look on his face. The defendant leans over to talk with Victor, and there is some whispering, and the defendant nods his head and mouths ‚ÄòThank you so much.‚Äô
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p8: Finally, the show is about to  be concluded, but there is one more act left to play. It‚Äôs Raymond‚Äôs turn to put on his acting face now. He has to at least make it look like he‚Äôs actually considering all of the information that the prosecution and defense has just provided. Otherwise, people might start to catch on that his mind was already made up the moment the defendant walked in the door, and who would trust that judgment? That would reek of bias and prejudice to everyone, and admittedly Raymond completely understands and would feel this way too if he were in their shoes and didn‚Äôt know about his ability. Hence the need to put on a good show for the people.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p9: Judge Elisando sat there, wearing his most convincing look of contemplation on his face, with his elbows on the table and his fingers slowly tapping together. Sometimes, this is the hardest part of the job. Not making the actual judgments, that‚Äôs actually the easy part thanks to his uncanny ability to see these auras, but finding a convincing way to explain why he is making this particular judgment, that‚Äôs the hard part. He can only use what information has been presented to him as his reasons, and lately, this has become even more difficult given his quick rise through the ranks and taking on more difficult cases.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p10: Nonetheless, he delivered his verdict after acting out much internal deliberation. ‚ÄúBased on all of the evidence provided, I find the defendant guilty of all charges,‚Äù Raymond said in his most confident and authoritative voice. Immediately, surprised murmuring can be heard throughout the courtroom, and naturally, a shocked and hurt look on the defendant‚Äôs face can be seen. Victor happened to look shocked as well, but also a bit concerned, hadn‚Äôt he presented a convincing case for his client not to be convicted of the intent to distribute illegal substances?
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p11: ‚ÄúOrder, order, please, order in the courtroom. Now, although I find the defendant guilty of all charges, let the record show that I will take into consideration all of the defense‚Äôs remarks when determining the sentencing for these charges.‚Äù This soothed the murmuring in the courtroom, but only a little. Despite this less than agreeable response from the courtroom, Judge Elisando stood and left the courtroom, heading back to his office.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p12: Raymond shrugged off his black gown and let out a deep sigh as he sat down, interlocked his fingers, placed his hands behind his head and leaned back in his office chair. He closed his eyes and immediately a river of thoughts began gushing through his mind. Soon he would have to serve as judge for some upcoming cases that are very high profile, much higher profile than he had served on before in fact. While the prospect of launching his career even higher into the atmosphere of success with these upcoming cases seemed like an incredible opportunity, he couldn‚Äôt help but feel a bit worried about how he would defend his judgments.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_1_content.p13: Recently, it‚Äôs been more and more difficult to portray a convincing response, given the shocked looks and surprised murmuring after the court case he had just finished presiding over. People just don‚Äôt understand, and they wouldn‚Äôt understand even if he explained his ability. `I guess this is just a small price to pay, I shouldn‚Äôt be complaining about feeling a little discomfort when making a tough judgment. I‚Äôd be doing this city a disservice if I wasn‚Äôt using this incredible ability.` he thought, watching thoughts swim around in his mind. Then he chuckled to himself. `Tough judgment, now that‚Äôs funny. The difficult part has nothing to do with the judgment...`
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p1: ‚ÄúRay, is everything okay?‚Äù Raymond‚Äôs wife Siloah asked him with a concerned look on her face as she sat down on the couch next to him. He let out a long sigh as he stared vacantly into space, swirling his glass of whiskey and making the ice clink against the sides of the glass. ‚ÄúYeah, everything is okay Sil, thank you for always being so good. I‚Äôm just a bit stressed about this murder case I have to preside over tomorrow. I‚Äôve never worked a case with this much publicity before, nor with this magnitude of charges‚Äù, he responded, snapping out of his vacant stare and looking into Sil‚Äôs eyes with gratitude and love.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p2: ‚ÄúWell, I think it‚Äôs completely reasonable to feel a bit stressed or nervous before a case like this, but you know what? I‚Äôve known you to judge hundreds of cases before this, and clearly you have the ability to do this. You‚Äôll be fine. I love you and I support you completely, Ray, just remember this okay?‚Äù, she said as she leaned forward to hug Ray and put her head on his shoulder. He lifted his chin slightly and turned to lean his head over onto hers. `Hah, it‚Äôs not the ability to judge this case that I‚Äôm worried about`, he thought.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p3: In that moment he wished more than anything that he could share his deepest secret, but despite this urge to share it with his most beloved friend and partner, his wife, something even deeper within him nagged and pushed him away from divulging it to her. He kissed her head and said, ‚ÄúI love you Sil, you‚Äôre the most amazing woman I know. Maybe you‚Äôre right, I‚Äôve come this far already and I intend to keep going. As long as I have you, I‚Äôll be alright.‚Äù Ray took two large swigs from his glass of whiskey, and fought back the stress eating away at him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p4: The next morning he woke up to his alarm blaring repeatedly, and unfortunately, he also woke up to a pounding headache. ‚ÄúAghhh‚Äù, he grunted as he reached for his phone to shut the alarm off. `What a wonderful way to start the morning of my big case`, Ray thought sarcastically as he sat up and placed his feet into his slippers next to the bed. He rubbed his eyes and massaged his temples while thinking `Good grief, my head is really killing me right now. I didn‚Äôt even drink that much whiskey last night, just one glass. Must‚Äôve been dehydrated too I guess.`
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p5: He walked into the kitchen and drank a full glass of water, then refilled it again and took some Paracetamol to relieve the pain. ‚ÄúGood morning Silly‚Äù, Ray playfully joked with Sil as he walked up and kissed her in the kitchen. She chuckled and kissed him back, replying ‚ÄúGood morning old man‚Äù with a smirk as she flipped over the eggs frying in the pan. ‚ÄúWhoa, whoa, who are you calling old?‚Äù he retorted, laughing and already beginning to feel better. ‚ÄúThanks for the breakfast dear, you are the best. I didn‚Äôt even hear you get up this morning‚Äù, Ray said as he sat down at the kitchen table. ‚ÄúWho says this breakfast is for you?‚Äù, Sil said tauntingly with a smile, turning to look at Ray. He met her gaze, raised one eyebrow, then began smiling as they both started laughing.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p6: A few moments later she brought over a plate of eggs, hash browns, and bacon with a glass of orange juice and set it in front of him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to do great today Ray, I believe in you. Enjoy your breakfast and drink your orange juice, it should make your head feel better and then you‚Äôll be ready to go.‚Äù ‚ÄúThank you, Sil. Have I ever told you that you‚Äôre the best? Because you are‚Äù he said as he took a big bite of food. ‚ÄúLove you‚Äù he said in a muffled voice with a mouth full of food. Sil laughed and kissed his forehead, ‚ÄúLove you too‚Äù.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p8: Raymond sat behind the big oak desk in his office, with the early morning light shining in from the window behind him and casting light onto the pile of documents he was reading. With his thumb massaging his right temple and his fingers on his forehead, he sighed and continued reading the document held in his left hand in front of him. Not only was his head still bothering him, but this case was turning out to be a bigger deal than he initially realized.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p9: Originally, he was under the impression that this was a murder investigation with some strange circumstances, but now it‚Äôs come to light that this defendant isn‚Äôt just some random person. The defendant is Quinton Franks, son of the wealthy and famous politician and business owner, Mason Franks.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p10: At a young age Mason had immigrated here with his parents, who then started a real estate business and quickly became wealthy. As he grew up, Mason loved going with his father to view the different real estate properties that were being bought and sold. This ended up providing him with many opportunities to meet other wealthy and famous people interested in the properties, including many different politicians and government officials, inspiring Mason to pursue a career in politics.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p11: Given that Mason, even from a young age when first meeting all of these officials, left a memorable impression on them as a clever and charming young man, it came as no surprise to the community when he ended up being elected as a State senator. Shortly after Mason‚Äôs election, however, his father passed away and left the family real estate business to him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p12: Many people worried about what would happen to either the business or Mason, thinking that there was no way he could handle both, but these worries were soon quashed when he married Cheryl Binds. Cheryl Binds, now Cheryl Franks, came from another family owned real estate business and knew exactly how to keep the business alive. Not only did she keep the business alive, but she expanded the business and began contracting towers to be built in major cities like New York, Seattle, and San Francisco, which propelled the family wealth into the top 10% of the country.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p13: About a year after the third tower was built, Mason and Cheryl had their son Quinton. Quinton had every opportunity to excel in life. He went to prestigious schools, met many famous politicians, business owners, and actors, who were all charmed by him, just like his father Mason. The difference with Quinton, however, is that he had a tendency to deal with some of the shadier characters in the world of business and politics.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p14: There had been at least a couple of occasions in the news where Quinton had been accused by whistleblowers for using his connections and power to influence business purchases and elections of officials that he supported, yet these officials did not seem to have the community support one would expect to see for an official that had supposedly been elected by the community. But as many of these accusations against high ranking people go, they were thrown out as hearsay and charges were dropped. The accusations did leave their mark on his reputation though, and the community had their growing suspicions and doubt of his trustworthiness.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p15: This information reeled in Raymond‚Äôs mind, making his head begin to pound again. He reached for the glass of water to his right and drank the entire glass, crunching and chewing the remaining ice as he continued to read the details of the murder Quinton was being accused of. Raymond‚Äôs eyes fervently scanned line after line of text, absorbing and digesting the information, fighting off any prejudices attempting to work their way into his mind.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p16: In the affidavit, Quinton is being accused of masterminding a plot to ‚Äútake care of‚Äù a problematic realtor, Mr. Jefferson, who leaked information about a scheme to launder money by purchasing property from a shady politician. Mr. Jefferson leaked documents that proved this transaction was not only money laundering, but also bribery, because Quinton actually already owned this property and essentially paid this politician as a bribe, using the purchase of property from the politician as a way to launder the money by making it look like the politician owned the property.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p17: When Mr. Jefferson failed to come home after work, his family called the police to report him missing, because they were already aware that he had leaked this information to a reporter and were worried something may have happened to him. Later it was discovered that the day Mr. Jefferson failed to come home after work, he had been showing a new property to Quinton in a remote area. Police found CCTV footage of Quinton and Mr. Jefferson driving together in the same vehicle on the way to the property, but on the way back only Quinton could be seen in the vehicle.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p18: Later, Mr. Jefferson‚Äôs family was told by an associate of his that he expressed worry over showing this property to Quinton alone, and then his family presented this information to police. Eventually when police found that Mr. Jefferson had ‚Äúfallen‚Äù from a cliff, and they put together the suspicious evidence, the murder charges were made against Quinton.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p19: Despite how suspicious all of the events surrounding the case seemed and how they seemed to be pointing directly at Quinton as the prime suspect, the prosecution was hard pressed to find any other evidence to directly tie him to the crime. At the scene there was no evidence of a struggle, in the CCTV footage Mr. Jefferson did not seem to be distressed while driving on the way out there, examining both Quinton‚Äôs and Mr. Jefferson‚Äôs phones yielded no incriminating or even remotely suspicious text messages, and furthermore, Quinton clearly and obviously hired the best lawyer he could afford, and he could afford more than most people in the country. Still, there was motive based on Mr. Jefferson leaking the information, Quinton was seen leaving without Mr. Jefferson after viewing the remote property, and the claims from the family and work associate about his worry to show this property to Quinton alone.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p20: ‚ÄúWhat am I getting myself into?‚Äù Raymond sighed to himself, setting the documents down and leaning back in his chair. He reached for his glass of water and rubbed his temples again, but realized the glass was empty. Walking over to the pitcher to pour some more water, Raymond mentally flipped through all of the potential ways this case could play out.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p21: In the courtroom, the case is beginning‚Ä¶
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p22: ‚ÄúAll rise‚Äù, said the bailiff as Judge Elisando entered the courtroom from the door behind his raised desk, and approached his seat. Immediately the murmuring of the court began to quiet down, and clicks and flashes could be heard and seen as the reporters tried to get the best angles before court was in session.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p23: ‚ÄúThank you, you may be seated‚Äù, Ray said as he too sat down at his raised desk. ‚ÄúNow, let‚Äôs set the record showing that this is just the preliminary hearing. After the prosecution has proclaimed the charges against the defendant and their merit for making these claims based on whatever evidence may be presented, the defense will have a chance to refute any accusations made by the prosecution and the defendant will plead either guilty or not guilty. From that point, I will make the judgment on how this case will proceed. Are we in agreement with these proceedings?‚Äù
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p24: ‚ÄúYes, your honor‚Äù, both the prosecution and defense responded simultaneously. ‚ÄúGood, then Mr. Thompson please proceed‚Äù, Raymond instructed. Mr. Eddie Thompson, the prosecution, thanked him as he stood up and straightened his tie.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p25: Walking toward the bench where Judge Elisando sat listening intently, Eddie began to disseminate all of the facts to the courtroom that Ray had previously been reading about in his office. When Ray happened to look at the defendant, Quinton, however, he noticed something strange with his aura. Looking directly at Quinton, he could only see a constant bright white aura of ultra high definition being emanated, but as Ray turned to continue looking at Eddie as he laid out the charges and evidence, he noticed a faint distortion and shimmering out of the corner of his eye.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p26: To confirm his suspicions, Ray continued to look at Eddie, but his focus was on the corner of his eye where Quinton was sitting. Sure enough, there it is. That same guilty shimmering distortion was definitely there. But how could this be? Ray had never seen anything like this before. Previously, it was always abundantly clear whether or not the defendant was guilty, but this time, it was almost as if Quinton was purposefully ‚Äúwearing‚Äù an innocent aura despite his guilty shimmering aura being emanated underneath his peculiar form of ‚Äúclothing‚Äù.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p27: `Truly, what am I getting myself into?``, Raymond thought to himself, feeling a bit worried now about how this case will turn out. Again, he focused on the corner of his eye where Quinton was calmly seated, not moving a muscle or displaying any kind of emotion whatsoever. Sure enough, that distorted shimmer was there.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p28: Raymond subconsciously began massaging his temple with his left hand, as that deep pain started to manifest behind his eyes again. `Man, maybe I need to look into a new prescription again. These glasses seem to work just fine, but focusing on the corner of my vision like that is not making my head feel happy, that‚Äôs for sure.`, he thought, continuing to rub his left temple.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p29: Finally, Eddie had finished presenting his charges and the evidence to support them, and the defense, Mr. Victor Broughton, stood up to begin his representation of the defendant. As Victor presented his defense, however, Ray was having trouble listening, because all he could seem to think about was how strange Quinton‚Äôs aura was.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p30: What finally ended up snapping Ray back to attention in the present moment was the defendant, Quinton, pleading ‚Äúnot guilty‚Äù. Now he knew it was his turn to carry on the show, and said ‚ÄúOnce the court has selected jurors for the trial, we will reconvene and both sides will have their opportunity to present the evidence and defense in depth to the jurors.‚Äù Ray stood up to leave back to his office and the bailiff once again said ‚ÄúAll rise‚Äù as he walked and opened the door to his office.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p31: Closing the door behind him, Ray let out a deep sigh and began massaging both of his temples, wincing at the pain behind his eyes. He walked back over to his office chair and took several swigs of the barely cool water left in his glass covered in condensation from the melted ice. Once the glass was empty, he inadvertently set the glass down forcefully which ended up shattering all over his desk and onto the floor.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_2_content.p32: ‚ÄúDamnit‚Äù, he said to himself. That‚Äôs when the unsettling thought occurred to him, what if this is an omen or a symbol of how this case will end up? But if it is, who‚Äôs the one that will end up shattered and in pieces, him or Quinton? Ray swallowed dryly and thought, `I hope not me`, but his gut was telling him something different‚Ä¶
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p1: Later that evening, Ray arrived at home with his mind still swimming from how this first hearing with the Quinton case went. He walked in the door and said, ‚ÄúHey Silly, I‚Äôm home now‚Äù, while kicking off his shoes and putting them on the shoe rack by the front door. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm in the kitchen fixing up dinner right now, come give me a kiss and tell me how it went,‚Äù she responded from around the corner in the kitchen.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p2: Ray walked into the kitchen and came behind Sil to give her a hug as she was chopping vegetables. She turned her head and they kissed, then she set down the knife, rinsed her hands, and turned to face him. ‚ÄúSo, how was the first hearing today? Did it go well? Also, how‚Äôs your head feeling now? I hope that breakfast this morning did the trick for you.‚Äù Ray let out a sigh and trailed off saying, ‚ÄúWell‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs just say I‚Äôve got my work cut out for me. This is not as cut and dry as I expected it would be, but I guess that‚Äôs my fault for not expecting there to be so much uncertainty. With promotions comes more difficult cases I suppose. And I still have a slight headache, but your breakfast definitely kicked me into gear this morning, thank you.‚Äù
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p3: Sil gave him another kiss, looked him in his eyes, and said, ‚ÄúI believe in you Ray. It‚Äôs not going to be easy, but you will make the right call, you always do. Why don‚Äôt you get some comfy clothes on and go watch some TV? I‚Äôll have dinner finished soon and I‚Äôll bring it over to you.‚Äù ‚ÄúYou are incredible Sil, thank you for being so good to me. I treasure you, and I love your cooking,‚Äù he said and they both chuckled at the last statement. They kissed again and he went to swap out his work clothes for comfy clothes.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p4: After getting his comfy clothes on and some slippers, he came and plopped down onto the couch, grabbed the TV remote and clicked to turn it on. `Alright, time to relax and catch up on some news for the day`, Ray thought as he actually began to relax finally. For the first time today, he noticed that his head was finally beginning to feel better. `Huh, must‚Äôve been stress related since my head is finally feeling better now that I‚Äôm relaxing`, he pondered to himself.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p5: He clicked through the channels and set the remote down after finding his usual news station. ‚Äú...so make sure you wear some sunblock tomorrow folks, it‚Äôs going to be hot and bright. Thankfully, we will have some cloud cover tomorrow evening though and things will cool down quite a bit. Over to you with today‚Äôs updates, John.‚Äù the weather forecaster said, with the stream changing over to the news anchor John sitting at his desk, papers in hand and a smile on his face.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p6: ‚ÄúThanks for the tip Ted! I‚Äôll have my sunblock ready for tomorrow. In today‚Äôs news, boy do we have a big story for you folks. Well, rather we‚Äôre going to have a big story for you that‚Äôs set to unfold over the coming weeks, potentially months. Quinton Franks, son of State Senator and real estate mogul Mason Franks, is now being accused of murdering one of his real estate agents that recently leaked information. Yes folks, the report of the potential money laundering and bribery that we mentioned here previously is the leaked information I‚Äôm talking about. There‚Äôs sure to be some eyes on this case, but Judge Raymond Elisando is set to preside over it and he seems to be on fire recently, so we‚Äôll be keeping a close eye on how things are progressing‚Ä¶‚Äù news anchor John said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll be back just after this, folks, stay tuned!‚Äù
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p7: Ray let out another long sigh, and felt his head start pounding again. `Sheesh‚Ä¶ This is crazy. The first hearing was just earlier today and they‚Äôre already all over the story. My head is definitely not happy about this, ugh. I need some water,` Ray thought, massaging his temples again as he got up to get a glass of water. ‚ÄúAh, sit down mister. I‚Äôve got your water right here, and I‚Äôll be right back with dinner,‚Äù Sil said, catching him before he got all the way up. ‚ÄúYou are good!‚Äù Ray laughed, as he sat back down. She leaned over and kissed him, before turning back around to grab the plates of dinner.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p8: With three big gulps of ice cold water, Ray let out a sigh of satisfaction, setting the glass down on the coffee table. A moment later Sil brought over two steaming plates of dinner, followed by another two plates with pumpkin pie and whipped cream on top. His eyes were immediately drawn away from the TV to the plates of pumpkin pie, and then he looked at Sil asking, ‚ÄúPumpkin pie? What are you doing to me, woman? Trying to fatten me up and make me fall even more in love with you?‚Äù. He mocked wiping drool from his lips and loudly slurping it up, making her laugh heartily. She leaned in and gave him several quick kisses all over his lips and cheeks, replying ‚ÄúLooks like my diabolical plan is working‚Äù while winking at him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p9: Sil grabbed the remote, turning the TV off, and they both held hands and closed their eyes to pray. ‚ÄúDear heavenly Father, firstly, thank You so much for everything that you‚Äôve already blessed us with. We ask that you bless this food and heal our bodies, and please give Ray the strength and discernment he needs to make the right judgements when presiding over this case. In Your name we pray, Jesus, Amen‚Äù. Ray opened his eyes and looked directly at Sil, full of love and gratitude, then kissed her for a long moment before finally saying, ‚ÄúThank you, Sil, I love you and I treasure you very much. I‚Äôm already feeling better. Now, let‚Äôs dig into this delicious feast you‚Äôve made!‚Äù
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p10: They both ate in silence, taking extra time to savor the delicious homemade pumpkin pie with whipped cream, then cleaned up the dishes. After a while, when they had both gotten ready for bed and crawled in together under the covers, they kissed again and wished each other a goodnight before turning the lights out. Surprisingly, Ray was able to fall asleep rather quickly this evening, and he drifted deeply into a dream‚Ä¶
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p11: Ray stood there in the hallway, just outside of the courtroom still wearing his Judge‚Äôs gown, and he was surrounded by reporters all holding up microphones and cameras that were flashing and clicking. They were almost like animals surrounding their prey, snarling and nearly foaming at the mouth as they asked him questions, pushing closer and closer to him. ‚ÄúWhat are you going to do about this case? Where‚Äôs your secret power now?‚Äù, one reporter shouted, catching Ray by surprise. ‚ÄúYeah Ray! Yeah! What about it? Do you really think your secret power is working? Can you trust it? Can we trust you?‚Äù, another reporter snarled viciously at him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p12: ‚ÄúOrder! Order in the court!‚Äù Ray shouted over all the noise. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not in court anymore, Ray! You have no power here! No order!‚Äù someone in the crowd screamed at him. Ray wiped beads of sweat from his forehead, trying to calm himself down and think of how to handle this crazy situation he‚Äôd gotten himself into. ‚ÄúListen! You don‚Äôt understand, it‚Äôs not that easy. Just give me a chance to explai‚Ä¶‚Äù, he was immediately cut off by hands beginning to grab at his gown, tearing it in the process. He kept getting pulled back and forth by the crowd until‚Ä¶
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p13: ‚ÄúAhhh! What are you doing!? Stop!‚Äù he shouted, trying to pull away from the reporters‚Äô mouths biting at his arms, back, and legs. His shouts fell on deaf ears, however, with more snarling and biting reporters climbing over each other to get a piece of him.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p14: ‚ÄúAhhhhh, ahhhhh, ahhhh!!!!‚Äù Ray screamed and thrashed in his sleep, waking up Sil in the process. ‚ÄúRay! Wake up, wake up!‚Äù, she shouted as she shook him awake. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre okay, it‚Äôs just a dream‚Äù, she said as he sat up and wiped beads of sweat from his forehead. ‚ÄúOhhh, wow, um‚Ä¶‚Äù Ray stuttered shakily. ‚ÄúY-yes, I-I‚Äôm okay. Wow, what an insane dream.‚Äù
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p15: ‚ÄúDo you want to talk about it?‚Äù Sil asked him softly. He reached over to the nightstand on his left, grabbed the glass of water, and drank the whole glass in a few large gulps. Wiping the remaining beads of sweat from his forehead, he turned to look at Sil and replied, ‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm okay now. You‚Äôre right, it was just a bad dream. I guess I‚Äôve got some worries about this case, but it‚Äôs nothing I can‚Äôt handle. I‚Äôll be alright.‚Äù She looked at him for a moment, concern showing in the wrinkles of her scrunched expression. ‚ÄúAlright, well, if you change your mind or want to talk in the morning then you know I‚Äôm always here for you. I love you, please try to get some more rest‚Äù, she responded.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p16: ‚ÄúI love you too, and sure, of course‚Äù, Ray said as he lay back down. Despite calming down and closing his eyes, he could only seem to toss and turn in bed, filled with worried thoughts of what that insane dream could possibly mean. Then, after what seemed like hours, he finally drifted back off to sleep.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p18: Raymond sat there in the driver seat of his car, gripping the steering wheel tightly with white knuckles as he saw the parade of news vans and cars parked just up the road, in front of the courthouse. `Damn, again? They‚Äôre like vultures! They circle around their prey, waiting for just the right moment to dive and tear into their next meal. Is it me, or is it Quinton that they‚Äôre circling though?` he thought as he clenched his teeth. ‚ÄúAgh!‚Äù he shouted, slamming the palm of his hand down onto the steering wheel, then turned to go into the parking garage behind the courthouse.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p19: He parked and went straight to his office. Once again thoughts were swimming through his mind, only this time he could feel their pace quickening as they approached the inevitable waterfall into anxiety and insanity. How appropriate this waterfall in his mind was, given the fact that Mr. Jefferson happened to have fallen, or potentially have been pushed, off of a cliff. The incessant sound of murmuring voices in the hallway from all of the reporters didn‚Äôt help things either. Today was the day when Ray would have to give his speech to the media and announce the date on which the verdict would be made regarding this case.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p20: Normally, a case like this would span months, but it seemed as though Quinton really wanted to exercise his right to a fair and especially speedy trial. His lawyers had continuously bombarded Ray with notices and motions and requests to move forward with this. It was as if he was being pressured to make a hasty decision, but why? Wouldn‚Äôt a hasty decision potentially give Quinton a verdict he wouldn‚Äôt be happy with? But wait, why even care about whether or not Quinton would be happy with the verdict? This is about making the right decision, not keeping the defendant happy.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p21: Ray opened the top drawer on the right side of his desk and grabbed a bottle of Paracetamol, twisted the cap and popped several of the pills into his mouth. He swallowed dryly, nearly gagging in the process, and then began massaging his temples. Lately it seemed like he was beginning to have more and more headaches, but he continued to attribute these to the growing stress of this case. `If these headaches don‚Äôt quit after I‚Äôm done presiding over this case, I‚Äôll go to a doctor.` he thought to himself, exhaling sharply.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p22: Looking at the watch on his left wrist, he saw that it was time to give the speech and he took in three deep breaths to calm his nerves. ‚ÄúOkay, let‚Äôs do this, '' he said to himself, gathering up his strength and confidence. He walked over to the door that led to the hallway filled with the incessant murmuring of the reporters, took in one last deep breath, then twisted the handle and opened the door.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p23: Immediately numerous camera clicks could be heard as the flashes illuminated the hallway like strobe lights. Fortunately, this time Raymond had a podium to stand behind as he gave his speech to the reporters, unlike his dream where he had been surrounded by ravenous and almost inhuman reporters.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p24: He cleared his throat and straightened his tie as he stood behind the podium, prompting all of the reporters and attendees to quiet down for his speech. ‚ÄúI would just like to preface this speech by reiterating that we do respect the presumption of innocence until proven guilty here, and the fact that we are moving forward with the case against Quinton Franks does not mean anything without proof beyond a reasonable doubt. That being said, we do have reason to believe that this case is worth a judge‚Äôs ruling in addition to a trial. The trial will be held next week on Monday, beginning at 8am and will span three days. I will use the following two days after the trial to review all evidence that has been submitted, as well as the findings of the jury. The Monday of the following week will be when a judgment is announced. If Mr. Quinton Franks is found to be innocent, then all charges will be dropped. If Mr. Quinton Franks is found to be guilty, then a separate hearing will be held to determine the sentencing, which will occur the following Monday after the verdict has been announced.‚Äù
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p25: Ray slowly took in another deep breath, and then announced that he will take a few questions. ‚ÄúI will now allow questions and I‚Äôll answer to the best of my ability. Remember, this is still an open case so I will not be answering any questions about the case itself, and I will not be answering any questions regarding my opinions about this case.‚Äù
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p26: Immediately the reporters all began asking questions, each reporter trying to be louder than the others in order for their question to be heard. It felt like chaos, and immediately Ray began to feel a bead of sweat rolling down the side of his face as he remembered the nightmare. Wiping away the sweat, he listened for a clear question which he was able to answer.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p27: ‚ÄúJudge Elisando, can you please tell us whether or not you‚Äôve ever presided over a murder case like this before, and why you‚Äôre the judge who has been deemed qualified to preside over this particular case?‚Äù a reporter in the middle of the crowd shouted. Raymond cleared his throat to signal the reporters to be quiet so he could answer, and then responded by saying, ‚ÄúFirst, I‚Äôd like to say that I have presided over hundreds of cases during my career, including cases involving manslaughter, murder, burglary, and many other charges. Each case is unique, despite circumstances sometimes seeming similar to other cases, so in that respect, no, I have never presided over a murder case like this before. I am, however, indeed qualified to preside over this case and I have no doubts that I will make a lawful decision based objectively on all of the evidence provided, and I will take into consideration the decision of the jury. The Governor is aware of the publicity and high-profile nature of this case, and he himself decided I would be the one to preside over this case. I trust his decision, and I trust my judgments.‚Äù ‚ÄúThank you Judge Elisando!‚Äù the reporter said, while jotting down notes onto his iPad.
theJudgeTextsList.chapter_3_content.p28: The reporters again began to shout over one another as they asked all different kinds of questions. After responding to the first question, however, Ray felt much more confident and he answered questions for the remaining time without any issue.  `Hah, and to think I was fretting about this meeting as if it would happen as it had in my dream. That actually went surprisingly well. Maybe tonight I‚Äôll finally get some good sleep again`, he thought. Soon, he was heading home and finally feeling good about moving forward with this case‚Ä¶
